Trial_Design.evidence: We conducted a single-center, randomized controlled trial.

Participants.evidence: Forty-five adults with abdominal injury (46.7%) or intra-abdominal sepsis (52.3%)

Intervention.evidence: randomly allocated to the ABThera (n = 23) or Barker's vacuum pack (n = 22)

Objective.evidence: To determine whether active negative pressure peritoneal therapy with the ABThera temporary abdominal closure device reduces systemic inflammation after abbreviated laparotomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the difference in the plasma concentration of interleukin-6 (IL-6) 24 and 48 hours after temporary abdominal closure application.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly allocated to the ABThera (n = 23) or Barker's vacuum pack (n = 22)

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-five adults with abdominal injury (46.7%) or intra-abdominal sepsis (52.3%) were randomly allocated

Result_Outcome.evidence: 90-day mortality was improved in the ABThera group (hazard ratio, 0.32; 95% confidence interval, 0.11–0.93; P = 0.04).
